title: Africa: CPJ Calls for Burkina Faso to Reverse Suspension of Jeune Afrique
description: [CPJ] Dakar -- The Committee to Protect Journalists on Wednesday called on Burkinabè authorities to lift its suspension of the French news magazine Jeune Afrique, reverse their suspension of other media outlets, and ensure journalists can work in the West African country without fear of reprisal.

title: Africa: CAF and IMG Conclude Agreement Making IMG the Global Sponsorship Agency of CAF
description: [CAF] The Confédération Africaine de Football ("CAF") and IMG have concluded an agreement making IMG the global sponsorship agency of CAF until 2025.

title: Africa: World Bank Predicts Bleak Economic Outlook for Sub-Saharan Africa
description: [New Dawn] WASHINGTON, October 4, 2023 -- Sub-Saharan Africa's economic outlook remains bleak amid an elusive growth recovery. According to the latest World Bank Africa's Pulse report, rising instability, weak growth in the region's largest economies, and lingering uncertainty in the global economy are dragging down growth prospects in the region.

title: Africa: Misinformation Influencing the Regulation of Novel Nicotine Products
description: [AllAfrica InfoWire] Atthe height of COVID-19, the general assumption by the scientific world was that COVID-19 would fill the gap between scientific data and policymaking, and probably lead to fact-based regulation. However, developments on the ground show that this has not happened and may not happen in the mid-term with regards to designing health policies, and later on, Tobacco Harm Reduction (THR).

title: Africa: 1 in 10 Babies Worldwide Are Born Preterm, With Complications, UN Agencies Warn
description: [UN News] An estimated 13.4 million babies were born early in 2020, with nearly one million dying from preterm complications, UN agencies and partners said in a new report on Thursday.

title: Africa: Google Announces 11 African Startups for Artificial Intelligence (AI) First Programme
description: [Premium Times] The 11 startups were picked from a vast pool of innovative talents using cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI).

title: Africa: 'Morocco, Spain and Portugal Hosting of World Cup 2030, Source of Pride for African Continent'
description: [MAP] Addis Ababa -- The organization of the 2030 World Cup by Morocco, Spain and Portugal "is a source of pride for the African continent", said Chairman of the African Union Commission, Moussa Faki Mahamat.

title: Africa: Nigerian Govt, Africa Finance Corporation Partner to Gather Data, Process Minerals
description: [Premium Times] Mr Alake explained that every effort being made through policies and programmes to make Nigeria a destination for solid minerals development will be futile if the nation doesn't improve on data gathering.

title: Africa: Cautious Welcome - World Bank and IMF Return to Africa, but Questions Remain
description: [The Conversation Africa] The annual meetings of the World Bank and International Monetary Fund (IMF) are due to take place in Marrakech, Morocco, in mid-October. The city and country are still reeling from a devastating earthquake in early September.

title: Africa: Our Teachers, Our Heroes
description: [IPS] New York -- Education Cannot Wait Executive Director Statement on World Teachers' Day

title: Africa: It's Time to Fix the Problem of Africa's 500% Debt Premium
description: [African Arguments] Rather than having too much debt, the challenge for countries in Africa may be that their debt is just too expensive. But there are remedies.

title: Africa: Mastercard Foundation and Africa CDC Remain Committed to Saving Lives and Livelihoods
description: [Africa CDC] Joint Statement of the Mastercard Foundation and Africa CDC in Response to Devex Articles of 3rd October 2023

title: Africa: Teachers Can Nurture Students Who Care About the World - Four Approaches That Would Help Them
description: [The Conversation Africa] Teachers wear many hats. They are expected to be subject matter experts, leaders, administrators, managers, lifelong learners - and not just in the classroom, but in their wider communities.

title: Africa: Did the Africa Climate Summit Fulfil Its Vision?
description: [African Arguments] A month on from the first ever Africa Climate Summit, a panel of experts reflect on its successes and failures.

title: Africa: Wanted - Teachers for Change!
description: [IPS] Bonn, Germany -- Once a year, on October 5, we celebrate World Teachers' Day. Why is it so important to have a closer look on the teaching profession? What is so special about being a teacher nowadays?

title: Africa: Debt-Pushing As Financial Inclusion
description: [IPS] Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia -- Ajay Banga was anointed World Bank president for promoting financial inclusion. Thanks to its success and interest rate hikes, more poor people are drowning in debt as consumer prices rise.

title: Africa: What Will It Take to Develop a Sustainable Vaccine Manufacturing Ecosystem in Africa?
description: [Africa CDC] A study of Africa's current and planned vaccine manufacturing capacity offers insights into how to target investments and development efforts to promote long-term success.
